poem:
**Undercover Aria**

In the industrial hum of the Ruhr,  
Ali donned the dust of a thousand stories.  
Steel sparks flew unnoticed,  
till his pen carved a mirror  
across an unsuspecting land,  
where voices rose in opera,  
each note a migrant's sigh—  
an aria of truth  
echoing through Germany's core,  
shaking the scaffolds of perception.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Opera tells story of German journalist who posed as migrant worker for two years Few people have done more to change the way postwar Germany looks at itself than Levent “Ali” Sigirlioğlu. A 1985 bestselling book detailing the inhumane working conditions and everyday racism that the 26-year-old Turkish migrant worker endured at Ruhr valley steel plants, asbestos-infested building sites and fast-food restaurants was the first to expose the dark underbelly of a booming postwar economic". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
